title: Saisher
author: Saisher
content: With the exception of Chipmixer, all the other signature campaigns are Crypto casino based, some are still for many years this is big proof that the Crypto casino industry is booming and the ICOs days are over, seven years ago all the signatures you see here are all Cryptocurrency projects.Do you think that this trend will go on for many years?Will Bitcointalk become known as a gambling forum?Will the days of the altcoins signature campaign return in the future?

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Quote from: Saisher on November 05, 2022, 02:54:01 PMDo you think that this trend will go on for many years?...Will the days of the altcoins signature campaign return in the future?Don't make us look like an instant fortune tellers or speculators. These question are out of hand of every user here, you will only hear a yes or no answer and some speculations backed of words without any valid proofs.Quote from: Saisher on November 05, 2022, 02:54:01 PMWill Bitcointalk become known as a gambling forum?You mean crypto gambling forum? Well, obviously, most casino accepting cryptocurrencies made an ANN thread here and runs signature campaign later on because their target users are mainly came from here, so i will say yes. Bitcoin gambling and crypto gambling subreddit are nothing compare the users/topics/discussion on the gambling board. Well, in fact bitcointalk gambling boards shows at as first rank in first page  when searching google using this keyword "crypto gambling forum" and "bitcoin gambling forum".

comments.author: mindrust
comments.body: It is only natural because gambling is one of the best and most preferred use cases of the crypto currencies. I think there are many more people that use crypto for gambling than for buying stuff or transferring wealth.And It is not a bad thing or a fault of the crypto. People simply love gambling. If there was another choice, people would use that too. Right now nothing beats crypto when it comes to gambling. It is fast, almost anonymous and reliable.

comments.author: bittraffic
comments.body: I think it will continue until google Adwords starts accepting gambling-related ads which is highly unlikely. Google back in 2018 if I remember bans crypto-related ads that also affected the crypto market in the bear market. One reason I believe casinos advertised in the forum is that demographics tell them that the target users are in the forum as well.

comments.author: cabron
comments.body: The forum is about Bitcoin. And since we use BTC in casinos then gambling is also discussed. Anything related to crypto can be advertised in the forum for now we are not seeing yet some e-commerce sites doing a signature campaign but it could happen in time. The forum ad auction of Theymos I think caught the attention of some companies other than casinos or crypto projects.

comments.author: acroman08
comments.body: Quote from: Saisher on November 05, 2022, 02:54:01 PMDo you think that this trend will go on for many years?can't really answer this as a yes or no, but I think as long as crypto gambling sites deemed advertising here is profitable, then I'd assume the trend it'll continue for many years.Quote from: Saisher on November 05, 2022, 02:54:01 PMWill Bitcointalk become known as a gambling forum?I seriously doubt it. the name itself already tells you what the forum is, and just because a lot of gambling sites advertises here in the forum does not mean the forum will be known as a "gambling forum"Quote from: Saisher on November 05, 2022, 02:54:01 PMWill the days of the altcoins signature campaign return in the future?I don't know, maybe.@OP you forgot about bestchange

comments.author: dimonstration
comments.body: Quote from: Saisher on November 05, 2022, 02:54:01 PMWith the exception of Chipmixer, all the other signature campaigns are Crypto casino based, some are still for many years this is big proof that the Crypto casino industry is booming and the ICOs days are over, seven years ago all the signatures you see here are all Cryptocurrency projects.Do you think that this trend will go on for many years?Will Bitcointalk become known as a gambling forum?Will the days of the altcoins signature campaign return in the future?Bounty campaigns still the majority of business here in the forum if you will compared the number of active campaigns on bounty board to the bitcoin marketplace service board. It's just many high rank and quality poster user preferred campaigns that pays in Bitcoin because it guarantee payment while bounty campaign reward rokens has no certainty that it will have value after the campaign.But bounty campaign is still much dominant rather than bitcoin campaigns in terms of number and participants.

comments.author: jakelyson
comments.body: Quote from: Saisher on November 05, 2022, 02:54:01 PMWith the exception of Chipmixer, all the other signature campaigns are Crypto casino based, some are still for many years this is big proof that the Crypto casino industry is booming and the ICOs days are over, seven years ago all the signatures you see here are all Cryptocurrency projects.I wish we could see the numbers that can support this claim. Is there a tool or post that monitors the active signature campaigns running? Without numbers, we cannot see the real stats. Maybe we are just overwhelmed by the number of posts gambling signature makes a day.Quote from: Saisher on November 05, 2022, 02:54:01 PMWill Bitcointalk become known as a gambling forum?Will the days of the altcoins signature campaign return in the future?I hope not. Bitcointalk is a forum about bitcoin and cryptocurrency. I hate that it would diminish to a single section just because cryptocurrency's most usage is casinos and gambling.

comments.author: darkangel11
comments.body: Let's start with the fact that not all signature campaigns are casinos. From time to time there's an altcoin signature and there are some unpaid campaigns or campaigns where you advertise the manager and he shares profits with you... There used to be a few mixer campaigns but those other mixers got scared of possible legal action against them. It's not that only casinos want to use this form of advertising but there are some entities that actively fight crypto businesses and casinos mostly managed to avoid these attacks. Quote from: Saisher on November 05, 2022, 02:54:01 PMDo you think that this trend will go on for many years?Will Bitcointalk become known as a gambling forum?Will the days of the altcoins signature campaign return in the future?It depends on legality of bitcoin. If there's a framework in place more businesses will pop up and decide to advertise. They will for sure. Altcoins usually flood the forum in bull market and get quiet in bear.

comments.author: dothebeats
comments.body: One main reason I see is because crypto casinos are popping off literally almost everywhere every single day. It's hard to make your brand recognized without some form of advertising like signature campaigns. Bitcointalk is like the main hub for all things crypto and bitcoin, and once you get the word out from here, there is a huge possibility that your platform will be referred to another people of which the referral will come from here. Previously signature campaigns were dominated by ICOs and IEOs and all that stuff during the boom of those things, but eventually, the gambling campaigns outnumber them just because gambling is the same old story but with always a different face and a different feel for them.

comments.author: jackg
comments.body: There's best change as well that isn't chipmixer and a few other signatures that aren't related directly to gambling.I think it's a matter of time before we see new campaigns coming out for different products (perhaps altcoins, exchanges, or crypto related services).I remember one of the altcoin signature campaigns being malware though too and it seemed quite well paid - that was probably the reason. A lot of ICOs that are well advertised don't make profits for a long time and a lot that are poorly advertised need to be timed well so people probably exited because of that.I also remember bitmixer and yobit seemed quite easy to enter which also took up a lot of signature space here for a while - they might also have had some role in deterring coinmakers and other companies from competing here - a 3 month ico campaign you have to be accepted into over a quick copy and paste task is probably not going to convince people to wait to be accepted.

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: Quote from: Saisher on November 05, 2022, 02:54:01 PMDo you think that this trend will go on for many years?Will Bitcointalk become known as a gambling forum?Will the days of the altcoins signature campaign return in the future?Yes I think so, gambling is helping this forum. If not for the gambling sites that are advertising their services on this forum, this forum traffic would have reduced. Bitcointalk is a bitcoin forum, but we can also say it is a gambling forum because most of the campaigns belong to gambling sites, but that does  not change that this forum is a bitcoin forum, the best you can get about bitcoin is from this forum. I do not think altcoins can be like before, there can be some campaigns during bull run, but it seems more that gambling will dominate for long. The days of altcoins dominance is over.

comments.author: Docnaster
comments.body: Quote from: Saisher on November 05, 2022, 02:54:01 PMWith the exception of Chipmixer, all the other signature campaigns are Crypto casino based, You may like to include Best_Change. It is not a casino campaign but it has lasted more than 1 year if not 2 years. Quote from: Saisher on November 05, 2022, 02:54:01 PMDo you think that this trend will go on for many years?Will Bitcointalk become known as a gambling forum?Will the days of the altcoins signature campaign return in the future?The days of altcoin signature campaigns is gone. It will not return again. Many altcoins are fake and would not spend much money to shill their project and there are other social media platforms to promote their projects. Gambling rule this forum, honestly if gambling board is removed from this forum, I will not be here again.

comments.author: ralle14
comments.body: Quote from: Saisher on November 05, 2022, 02:54:01 PMDo you think that this trend will go on for many years?Will Bitcointalk become known as a gambling forum?Will the days of the altcoins signature campaign return in the future?There's no way of telling how long the trend of crypto signature campaigns would last since we don't know when will other crypto services are planning to set up their signature campaign.Some of the signature campaigns coming from the alt section were good back then but now they have more ways to promote their crypto aside from signature campaigns here in the forum so I doubt we'll see them come back. On the other hand, we could see more campaigns potentially pay altcoins similar to how BK8 shifted their payments from BTC to Tether.

comments.author: Strongkored
comments.body: Don't forget that there is still an altcoin campaign that has been running for years and is still surviving, namely Gold StablecoinIf another business sees that there is an opportunity to gain exposure to its website it may be that a different business will advertise on this forum through a signature campaign, but that's only a possibility until we see it actually happen.However, promoting altcoins in this forum seems to be difficult because most of them are not legit.

comments.body: Quote from: Saisher on November 05, 2022, 02:54:01 PMWith the exception of Chipmixer, all the other signature campaigns are Crypto casino based, some are still for many years this is big proof that the Crypto casino industry is booming and the ICOs days are over, seven years ago all the signatures you see here are all Cryptocurrency projects.Even back then you would see mixers and gambling sites advertising here in the forum. Now a days no one gives a shit about alts, forget about scams and the ICO as both are synonymous  .Quote from: Saisher on November 05, 2022, 02:54:01 PMWill Bitcointalk become known as a gambling forum?Will the days of the altcoins signature campaign return in the future?As the name suggests it is a bitcointalk forum and multiple topics are covered here. Alts days are over a long back. You do not need someone to create new alts everyday .

comments.author: Docnaster
comments.body: Quote from: Strongkored on November 05, 2022, 06:12:29 PMDon't forget that there is still an altcoin campaign that has been running for years and is still surviving, namely Gold StablecoinThis is wonderful. The campaign was first announced in July 2019 and it is still running till today. I don't know that a bounty campaign can last this long. It is a good one. There are some facts one will get to know everyday or some forgotten that we get reminded of in this forum.It takes only genuine project to last more than one year and still promoting their project. Kudos to Gold stable coin.

comments.author: erep
comments.body: Quote from: Strongkored on November 05, 2022, 06:12:29 PMDon't forget that there is still an altcoin campaign that has been running for years and is still surviving, namely Gold StablecoinIf another business sees that there is an opportunity to gain exposure to its website it may be that a different business will advertise on this forum through a signature campaign, but that's only a possibility until we see it actually happen.However, promoting altcoins in this forum seems to be difficult because most of them are not legit.Campaign Gold Stablecoins are the only ones that last for long term campaigns but they have few participants and monthly payments (if I'm not mistaken). I appreciate that they are the longest running altcoin campaign in this forum and I am sure that the project will get good feedback from the impact of that campaign. But it is difficult for altcoin campaigns/bounties to grow again because most altcoins from projects are not legal, and now many top new projects are changing promotion patterns to provide incentives for participants to take tesnet, feedback, swaps and more. So it seems that many members are hunting to become part of the gambling campaign because of the weekly payouts and the long-term running of the campaign.
